meanings.definition: The condition of being able to see clearly in bright light.
meanings.sent1: In the photopia of the sunny day, everything was so clear and bright.
meanings.sent2: She experienced photopia when she stepped out into the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The photopia was so intense that she had to squint her eyes.
meanings.sent4: The photopia of the beach at noon was blinding, like a sea of light.
meanings.sent5: His photopia was so sharp that he could see every detail in the landscape.

meanings.definition: A visual sensation experienced when looking at a bright light source.
meanings.sent1: The photopia from the flashlight was dazzling in the dark.
meanings.sent2: He felt a sudden photopia when he stared at the car headlights.
meanings.sent3: The photopia from the fireworks made the night sky come alive.
meanings.sent4: Her photopia of the city lights was like a painting in motion.
meanings.sent5: The photopia of the stars twinkling above was mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: The ability to see in bright light.
meanings.sent1: His photopia allowed him to navigate easily in the bright daylight.
meanings.sent2: She appreciated her photopia when she could read without any strain.
meanings.sent3: The photopia of the owl enabled it to hunt effectively at night.
meanings.sent4: The photographer's keen photopia captured the essence of the sunrise.
meanings.sent5: The bird's photopia was crucial for spotting prey from a distance.
